title: Hubble Captures Cotton Candy Clouds
description: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image features a sparkling cloudscape from one of the Milky Way’s galactic neighbors, a dwarf galaxy called the Large Magellanic Cloud. Located 160,000 light-years away in the constellations Dorado and Mensa, the Large Magellanic Cloud is the largest of the Milky Way’s many small satellite galaxies. This view of dusty gas clouds […]
author: Monika Luabeya

title: NASA Sets Coverage for Axiom Mission 4 Launch, Arrival at Station
description: NASA, Axiom Space, and SpaceX are targeting 8:22 a.m. EDT, Tuesday, June 10, for launch of the fourth private astronaut mission to the International Space Station, Axiom Mission 4. The mission will lift off from Launch Complex 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. The crew will travel to the orbiting laboratory on a […]
author: Jessica Taveau

title: Why it's taking a century to pin down the speed of the universe
description: The Hubble constant, a set number that connects a galaxy’s speed to its distance from Earth and tells us how fast the universe is expanding, was first described more than a hundred years ago – but astronomers have debated it ever since

title: Private ispace Resilience probe will attempt lunar landing this week
description: If successful, Resilience will be only the third private spacecraft to complete a landing on the moon, and the first operated by a non-US company

title: Aliens, asteroid mining … and Mars births? Royal Society envisions next 50 years in space
description: UK needs a ‘clear national ambition’ to avoid missing out as science changes rapidly, Space: 2075 report warnsHumanity must prepare for a sweeping revolution as nations and companies gear up to build moon bases, space stations and orbiting factories, and uncover evidence – if evidence is out there – that we are not alone in the universe.A horizon-scanning report from the Royal Society envisions a new era of space activities that will reshape the world, including clean energy beamed to Earth, robots that mine asteroids or recycle dead satellites, and manufacturing plants that circle the planet churning out products labelled “Made in Space”. Continue reading...
author: Ian Sample Science editor

title: Milky Way photographer of the year 2025 – in pictures
description: This year’s collection of images from Capture the Atlas features an extraordinary milestone: a historic photograph of our galaxy taken from the International Space Station by Nasa astronaut Don Pettit, who recently returned from his latest mission onboard the ISS Continue reading...
author: Matt Fidler

title: 'Joy,' a plush baby swan, will launch with Axiom Mission-4 crew as zero-g indicator
description: When an international crew of astronauts launch on a commercial space mission, they will be joined by a स्वैन, a łabędź or a hattyú. Or, in English, a swan.

title: ispace's Resilience spacecraft lands on the moon this week: Here's how to see the landing zone on the lunar surface
description: The lander won't be visible from Earth, but its landing site on Mare Frigoris will be.
author: Anthony Wood
